data.title: NBA All-Star Weekend: Jayson Tatum, Jaylen Brown and more
data.meta_description: The NBA All-Star Weekend is Feb.16-18. Find out what events are going on, when they are, and who will be participating.
data.text:
The NFL season may be over, but the NBA season is still underway. The All-Star weekend starts Friday in Indiana.

The biggest change this year is that the All-Star Game on Sunday will go back to the original format of East vs. West, instead of two captains voting to select players to be on their team regardless of conference.

The headline of this year's weekend will be Boston Celtics' own Jaylen Brown competing in the Dunk Contest on Saturday. Brown will be the first all-star to compete in both the All-Star Game and Dunk Contest since DeAndre Jordan in 2017. Jayson Tatum will join his all-star teammate in Sunday's game as an all-star starter.

Here are the other events happening this weekend and all the participants.

Friday, Feb. 16

Panni Rising Stars Practice at 11 a.m. on NBA TV

Watch the first- and second-year players practice before they take the court later that night.

Basketball Hall of Fame news conference at 5:30 p.m. on NBA TV

Find out who the finalists are for the 2024 Half of Fame Class.

All-Star Celebrity Game at 7 p.m. on ESPN

Check out favorite entertainers to see if they got game, or should stick to their day jobs.

Team Shannon (Sharpe) w/coaches Peyton Manning and 50 Cent

Anuel AA (Latin American Music Award-winning recording artist)

Kai Cent (Streamer and Youtuber)

Conor Daly (IndyCar Series racer)

Walker Hayes (Grammy Award-nominated recording artist)

Quincy Isaiah (Actor)

Jewell Loyd (two-time WNBA champion and five-time Seattle Storm All-Star)

Micah Parsons (Cowboys DE)

Lilly Singh (Emmy Award-winning entertainer)

SiR (Grammy Award-nominated recording artist)

Dylan Wang (Actor)

Team Stephen A. (Smith) w/coaches A'ja Wilson and Lil Wayne

Metta World Peace (former NBA player)

Jack Ryan (basketball entertainer)

CJ Stroud (Houston Texans QB)

Gianmarco Tamberi (Olympic High Jump champion)

Adam Blackstone (Grammy Award-nominated musician)

Natasha Cloud (WNBA Champion and Phoenix Mercury guard)

Jennifer Hudson (talk show host, actress, producer)

Tristan Jass (content creator)

AJ Mclean (Grammy Award-nominated recording artist)

Kwame Onwuachi (James Beard Award-winning chef)

Rising Stars at 9 p.m. on TNT

Team Pau (Gasol)

Bilal Coulibaly (Rookie, Washington Wizards)

Jamie Jaquez, Jr. (Rookie, Miami Heat)

Brandon Miller (Rookie, Charlotte Hornets)

Brandon Podziemski (Rookie, Golden State Warriors)

Jabari Smith, Jr. (Sophomore, Houston Rockets)

Cason Wallace (Rookie, Oklahoma City Thunder)

Victor Wembanyama (Rookie, San Antonio Spurs)

Team Tamika (Catchings)

Paolo Banchero (Sophomore, Orlando Magic)

Dyson Daniels (Sophomore, New Orleans Pelicans)

Jalen Duren (Sophomore, Detriot Pistons)

Keyonte George (Rookie, Utah Jazz)

Scoot Henderson (Rookie, Portland Trailblazers)

Jaden Ivey (Sophomore, Detriot Pistons)

Keegan Murray (Sophomore, Sacramento Kings)

Team Jalen (Rose)

Jordan Hawkins (Rookie, New Orleans Pelicans)

Chet Holmgren (Rookie, Oklahoma City Thunder)

Walker Kessler (Sophomore, Utah Jazz)

Dereck Lively (Rookie, Dallas Mavericks)

Benedict Mathurin (Sophomore, Indiana Pacers)

Shaedon Sharpe (Sophomore, Portland Trailblazers)*

Jalen Williams (Sophomore, Oklahoma City Thunder)

Jeremy Sochan (Sophomore, San Antonio Spurs)

* Sharpe is injured and will not play; replaced by Sochan.

Team Detlef (Schrempf)

Izan Almansa (G League Ignite)

Matas Buzelis (G League Ignite)

Ron Holland (G League Ignite)

Mac McClung (Osceola Magic)

Tyler Smith (G League Ignite)

Oscar Tshiebwe (Indiana Mad Ants)

Alondes Williams (Sioux Falls Skyforce)

Saturday, Feb. 17

NBA All-Star Practice and Media Day at 11 a.m. on NBA TV

All-star players practice and talk to the media.

NBA HBCU Classic 2024 at 2 p.m. on NBA TV, TNT, ESPN2

Virginia Union will take on Winson-Salem in the annual HBCU Classic Game.

Commissioner Adam Silver News Conference

NBA Commissioner Adam Silver will talk about the NBA, All-Star Weekend and will take questions from the media.

All-Star Saturday Night at 8 p.m. on TNT

Skills Challenge (1st event)

Team Pacers: Tyrese Haliburton (Pacers), Bennedict Mathurin (Pacers), Myles Turner (Pacers)

Team Top Picks: Paolo Banchero (Magic), Anthony Edwards (Timberwolves), Victor Wembanyama (Spurs)

Team All-Stars: Scottie Barnes (Raptors), Tyrese Maxey (76ers), Trae Young (Hawks)

3-Point Contest (2nd event)

2024 Participants:

Malik Beasley (Milwaukee Bucks)

Jalen Brunson (New York Knicks)

Tyrese Haliburton (Indiana Pacers)

Damian Lillard (Milwaukee Bucks) *

Lauri Markkanen (Utah Jazz)

Donovan Mitchell (Cleveland Cavaliers)

Karl-Anthony Towns (Minnesota Timberwolves)

Trae Young (Atlanta Hawks)

* defending champ

Stephen Curry vs Sabrina Ionescu (3rd event)

The NBA record holder for the most 3-pointers, Golden State Warriors guard Stephen Curry, will compete against WNBA single-season 3-point record holder New York Liberty guard Sabrina Ionescu in the first-ever NBA vs. WNBA 3-Point Challenge.

Slam Dunk (4th event)

Jaylen Brown (Boston Celtics)

Jamie Jaquez Jr. (Miami Heat)

Mac McClung (G League, Osceola Magic) *

Jacob Toppin (New York Knicks)

* defending champ

Sunday, Feb. 18

NBA Legends Awards at 11.30 a.m. on NBA TV

The National Basketball Retired Players Association hosts its annual awards event.

G League Up Next Game

Watch the best player of the G-League compete in a Slam Dunk Contest, and 28 players (four teams) compete against each other in tournament-style games.

NBA All-Star Game at 8 p.m. on TNT

East Starters

Giannis Antetokounmpo, Milwaukee Bucks

Joel Embiid, Philadelphia 76ers *

Tyrese Haliburton, Indiana Pacers

Damian Lillard, Milwaukee Bucks

*injured

Jaylen Brown, Boston Celtics

Tyrese Maxey, Philadelphia 76ers

Head coach: Chris Finch, Minnesota Timberwolves
